TopicTitle: bought the game= yes got a few questions + a few tricks = begainers

Articles.Content:
well just got here as week ago and man i said I got to buy this game, was playing with the free version here, but its good to a point if u don`t want to play with mods that much.

the best ones are updated and will need the bought version, pls support the game and buy it. in the end we will get tons of stuff,

this seem like a good game and support seems to want to help out = check the updates, so many of them, my game runs great from the start, but I need more mods, moreeeee

I modded for 10 years , I might mod this one day. so I kind of know what u need for a modded game to play it, so ..... the few tricks

back up, back up your folder every time u add a few mods into it, check if it works, not all mods will work

be picky with the mods u will play the game, as it won`t be the same as testing them, so make 2 copy if your the one that wants to test them a lot, me I`m building up my parts, so I`m copying folders, as in copy past it in the same place

we need an auto install prog. so u could take them out and install easily, that will prob come later .

can`t wait for the universe to expand in this amazing game, hoping with time someone will mod a few more solar system

so for my question is how many mods can u add?? is there a limit, as more i add the longer it takes to load the game??? it doesn`t lag as i got a high end computer.

Add as much as your computer can handle.

I am well past 20 and haven't experienced a single crash in 0.20.2

20, hehe i`m well into the 100 +, but no crash . cought, cought:D, i`m a bad driver and are massacring, if that is a word.. killing all my kerbal!!!, now with the mechjeb i`m kind of learning and it makes the unflyable rockets,etc work

anyone got there 2 cent to add?

Edited June 15, 2013 by mjy

I don't understand this, except the last:

You can install unlimited mods. It will take more time to load, but that's ok. It can get laggy, but that's up to your pc(old laptop is probally more laggy than a super computer).
But currently, KSP is 32-bit, so it can only use 4 GB of RAM. No matter how good your PC is.
